channel.title: Astro Club FC – Console
channel.description: Recent content in Console on Astro Club FC

item.title: API tokens in Console… with API and Clever Tools tips
item.description:
With Clever Tools 3.12, we’ve introduced a new way to query Clever Cloud’s API, with the API bridge and API tokens. Starting today, you can create, edit and revoke API tokens directly from your Clever Cloud profile page.

API tokens in the Clever Cloud Console

This interface also shows the token name, description, public ID, creation and expiration date.

To create an API token, you need to provide:

  • Your current password
  • Your 2FA code if active (activate it here)

If you created your Clever Cloud account through the GitHub integration, you’ll be asked to set a password first.

Clever Tools and API tips in the Console

This interface also introduces a new Web Component to show Clever Tools commands and API requests related to the page you visit. In the coming weeks, we’ll add more of these tips over the Clever Cloud Console.

item.title: List and revoke your active Console sessions
item.description: There is now a dedicated page to list web sessions in the Clever Cloud Console. It shows all the sessions currently active across your devices and browsers with creation/expiration date, last activity. You can revoke any sessions, except the current one (disconnect from the Console to revoke it).

item.title: New look for OAuth tokens management
item.description:
After renewing OAuth consumers management, we’ve just updated the OAuth tokens section of users profile. It’s where you can see applications linked to your Clever Cloud account: Clever Tools, the Console or those linked to other OAuth consumers. You can still see creation and expiration date, last usage, revoke any or all of them… but in a clearer interface.

We also added a link to Clever Cloud’s OAuth tokens documentation.

  • Learn more about OAuth tokens

item.title: New look for OAuth consumers management
item.description:
A new interface is available in Clever Cloud Console to create and manage OAuth consumers. It’s better, clearer, simpler, and uses our open source web components.

  • Learn more about OAuth consumers

item.title: Console: old logs stack decommission
item.description:
Last year we introduced a new logs interface in the Console and enhanced it since then. After some months using it by default, we start decommissioning our old logs stack. Thus, you can’t switch to the previous interface anymore for applications.

Next, we’ll use the new stack for add-ons, access logs and continue improving the interface. A big step will be to introduce logs indexing, allowing you to better search through your logs and load the latest.

Feel free to ask for features and improvements in our GitHub Community space.

item.title: Console: end of life versions warnings
item.description:
Earlier this year, we started to show warnings in logs when you deploy PHP applications with a CC_PHP_VERSION corresponding to a release considered as end-of-life by PHP community. Today, we start showing such warnings in the environment variables panel of applications in the Clever Cloud Console for:

  • CC_PHP_VERSION
  • CC_PYTHON_VERSION
  • CC_RUBY_VERSION

Our goal is to better inform our customers about the lifecycle of their ecosystems, and to provide guidance on the proper values to use for the version management of their applications. We’ll extend this to other runtimes in the coming weeks.

item.title: Console: new Domains management interface
item.description:
We’ve upgraded the applications’ Domains page in the Console. It’s now more clear, complete and easy to use. We designed it to highlight some of our underrated features such as path routing. You also now have:

  • A unique form to add a custom domain or a test domain (cleverapps.io)
  • A unique list of test and custom domains
  • A direct link to add your own certificate
  • Clearer error messages/warnings
  • Clearer instructions about DNS configuration and IP lists
  • Better accessibility, responsiveness, internationalization

item.title: Console: new logs interface is now used by default
item.description: New logs interface is available in the Console in public beta for some months, and we already enhanced it. We’re now confident enough to use it by default. You can still disable it. If you have any question or feedback, use our GitHub Community space.

item.title: Console: a fix for accountant access
item.description: Users with an “accountant” role were constantly disconnected from the Console. This issue has been fixed.

item.title: Better new Logs
item.description:
We recently introduced a new Logs interface for applications in the Console, available on-demand in public beta. Since, we listened customers feedbacks and improved this feature. An updated version is now available, with two modes in the text filter field:

  • Exact match (case-sensitive)
  • Regular expression

You can select one or the other using the buttons to the right of the text field. This is only a first step, as we’ll later introduce a new stack with indexed logs to better handle such filters and provide new features.

Some of you also asked for a change of the default behavior of this Logs interface. Until now, users were redirected to Live view during a deployment, otherwise to the 7 days view, containing all available deployments/instances, with logs of the last deployment shown. We today introduce a new mechanism and now remember the last choice of a user, per application.

Depending on your feedback, we’ll improve this further in the coming weeks. Here again, this is a first step as the indexed logs will open up a wide range of possibilities in this area.

  • Share your comments and ideas on our GitHub Community

item.title: Manage Clever Tasks in the Console
item.description:
Since its release 3.5.2, Clever Tools is able to manage Clever Tasks. It’s now possible to create, configure and deploy them directly from the Console. To declare an application as a Task, check the corresponding box in the Information tab.

A Clever Task can be run on demand. It executes the command you’ve set in the CC_RUN_COMMAND environment variable, without waiting for any HTTP request on the 8080 port. After that, the application stops. It’s just billed for the execution time.

item.title: Console's components upgrade
item.description: In our ongoing effort to improve our Console experience, we upgraded some of its components. It now uses JS Client 8.2.0 and Web Components 13.0.0. This update also brings some fixes regarding deployment logs links and Warp10 calls.

item.title: Console update and Clever Web Components v12
item.description:
Among other changes under the hood, our Console now uses the latest release of Clever Web Components. This v12 paves the way to our new log components. It also gives multiple new features with some bug fixes, refactoring and breaking changes.

  • Read the full changelog 📖

Links to the new documentation are now available in the Console. They’re more precise depending on the variant (e.g. PHP/Static), use small icons to boost visibility and are now effective for applications and add-ons:

item.title: Updated DNS entries for the PAR region
item.description: Setup of our new infrastructure in Paris implies addition of new IP which can be used for DNS entries. They are now detailed in the Domain Names section of your applications in the Console.
